metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1336 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The daily mandb cleanup job in Man-db before 2.7.6.1-1 as packaged in Ubuntu and Debian allows local users with access to the man account to gain privileges via vectors involving insecure chown use.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

man-db - 2.7.6.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: man-db package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.6.1-1').
